text: oh God hi everyone Indiegogo funded
brain surgery here the internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of this new Metro Boomin project
heroes and villains legendary hip-hop
producer and trap Sensei Metro boom and
he is back if you're unfamiliar with
this man he is the musical architect to
some of the biggest uh rap mainstream
hits over the past 10 years and he's got
a lot of success to celebrate at this
point as he did in 2018 when he dropped
his first solo project not all heroes
wear capes where he essentially played
director bringing some ambitious
production to the table and curating
features from some of his most frequent
and favorite collaborators from over the
years and it's pretty much the same deal
on heroes and villains even down to the
superhero themes in the title and in
some transitional moments between the
tracks we have another nice tight
tracklist from Metro boom in this time
around too at 14 songs 45 minutes or so
in an era where art is just seem to
bloat their projects out for no reason
whatsoever I love that Metro continues
to show focus on his records be it
through a collab or an outing more like
this though I do have to mention an
issue right out of the gate here there's
a lot of real estate on this record
given to a future and especially 21
Savage now am I surprised by this not
particularly because Metro has made some
of his biggest cuts and hits over the
years with these guys but it's pretty
clear on this project he wants to hang
in his comfort zone which I think does
put some limitations on it because at
this point he has the potential to bring
some pretty insane people onto this
project but again it's mostly familiar
faces over and over and over but at
least the musical presentation of this
thing feels big we have on time which I
wouldn't say is the most cohesive intro
track I've heard on a record this year
but it does bring a lot of impressive
displays of vocals strings even Morgan
Freeman is in the mix at one point kind
of sounds like two or three very
expensive movie trailers crashing into
each other what's more important is the
First full length song that the record
flows into a featuring Future superhero
is great with its Grand and Grim horn
Loops woozy trap beats and features
intoxicating auto-tune laced flow just
kind of putting me in a trance not a ton
of variation to the track across its
length but it's really about the vibe
that's truly the draw of this one and it
is a dense and enchanting Vibe will also
commend Metro on the outro on this song
too the vocal Melodies and instrumental
palette switch up is cool it's a nice
little epilogue to finish the song off
with and give us kind of a breather
before we hit the next track and there's
one of many moments like this throughout
the lp like the touch future brings at
the end of the song too many nights
which is primarily held by Don Toliver
who I think manages to come through with
one of his better songs here there are a
lot of slick vocal licks across this
very Reverb soaked track but really what
truly makes the song is the production
there are a lot of chill groovy rhythms
sound tracking the song along with a lot
of synth work that feels like it's
straight out of the 80s this track is
very Neon Lights Miami Nights humidity
that you could cut with a knife there's
a similar mix of Vibes coming off the
other Don Toliver track on the record
though maybe not as as potent there are
more highlights to come in the track
list though like umbrella featuring 21
Savage young nudie is featured on the
track as well and I would say Vibe wise
this is nothing entirely new it's just
kind of another helping of that bare
dark murderous vibe that 21 and Metro
struck so well together on Savage mode
one and two but they do it very well
once again here with some very heavy
piano Loops 21 dropping bars like put
your name on the bullets while I'm
filling them all the Ops scared because
we're killing them and while nudie isn't
necessarily one of my favorites out
there today he does have a nice vocal
contrast to what 21 brings to the table
plus if you love this track on the
record you will most likely enjoy walk
them down later on the album as well
where you know you're pretty much
getting another hit of the same energy
but now we're getting some massive horn
sections in the mix Metro spider
features maybe the most solid solo
performance on the entire project from
Young Thug the bells the string beds the
epic piano arpeggios all give thugger's
melodic and rhythmic switch UPS a
cinematic Flair he's melodically
wrapping across this track Like a
machine a total monster with no breaks
and it's just a tragic reminder of the
life and talent that is being lost
currently with him being locked up the
biggest hit potential on this album I
feel comes by way of the song Creepin
featuring weekend and 21 Savage where we
do have a fully fleshed out pop rap and
R B Crossover with verses choruses the
whole nine the topic of the song Being
not wanting to know about your girl uh
creeping and seeing other guys on the
side because your heart can't take it if
she's going to do that sort of thing uh
keep it on the DL it's a tragic little
track I suppose and 21 Savage adds quite
a bit to the themes of the song with his
verse as well and to continue the praise
I have for this project let me shout out
the closer Field of Fire which not only
switches things up with like a three
four or a six eight time signature ASAP
Rocky is sounding fantastic on the beat
as well with some cute and playful bars
and wordplay so this song does end
things on kind of a warm note on a
positive note but a hopeful and moving
one as well because takeoff is featured
on the track as well his inclusion on
the track is great and obviously it's a
powerful statement to have him finishing
things up in a way however not every
track on this project is a strong one
and many of the weakest moments on this
thing come down to
um a single Factor honestly and that's
Travis Scott to be honest I think he is
the weakest link in the chain as far as
features go on this thing on the track
Niagara Falls his courses are on point
but his verses couldn't be more
heartless now to lunch what is the point
he has similarly underwhelming
performances on raindrops as well as
trance thugger's appearance is great but
then there's Travis dropping bars like
I'm cleaning [ __ ] out like a enema then
lock on me where Travis and future are
together is just another instance of
Metro uh digging himself deeper into
this Travis hole and coming out with
literally nothing to show for it so yeah
there are some Duds but really it is
like the lack of variety among the
features that I think is kneecapping the
full potential of this project because
when a cut on here does stick it sticks
hard and the production is consistently
quality really Metro sticking to a lot
of his familiar trap formulae but
elevating it a bit with some strings
horns extra instrumentation a sample or
two also the outros on these tracks so
overall I see this as a solid record a
very good a very solid record from Metro
an improvement on his last one for sure
hopefully with the next LP he can get a
bit more ambitious on the feature and
songwriting and because really
everything else on this as far as like
quality you know the boxes are checked
on this project and I just think there's
room for improvement uh honestly room
for improvement and growth feeling a
light to decent seven on this one
